revised_title: Insect Faunas of Late Devensian and Flandrian Age: Church Stretton, Shropshire
tldr: The author examines insect faunas from late Devensian and Flandrian deposits in Church Stretton, Shropshire, to infer changes in ecology and climate. The study reveals diverse biotopes and suggests that the climate during the Flandrian period was at least as warm as today, potentially even warmer. The research provides valuable insights into the environmental conditions of the past and their implications for the present and future.
